com.brightcove.player.mediacontroller

Interface ShowHideController

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BrightcoveControlBar
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BrightcoveControlBarImpl

    public interface ShowHideController
    Defines the facilities for managing media controls visibility. Using and customizing: Applications can show media controls by either emitting an SDK SHOW_MEDIA_CONTROLS event or calling the show() method from a class implementing the ShowHideController interface, such as the Brightcove DefaultMediaController. Similarly to hide the media controls, applications can emit the SDK HIDE_MEDIA_CONTROLS event or call the hide() method. Either an animation style or a timeout value can be specified as attributes in the layout file using the Brightcove attributes bmc:animation-style (spedifying one of "fade" or "slide") or bmc:timeout. The timeout value is an integer number of seconds specifying the amount of delay after showing the media controls until they are automatically hidden. A value of 0 will result in the media contrtrols being permanently visible. A number of gists have been provided on GitHub to illustrate customizing showing and hiding the media controls. This Gist illustrates how to customize the application to always have the media controls displayed after setting a video. This Gist shows how to easily add rewind and fast forward buttons while establishing default values of seven seconds back and twenty-one seconds forward. After showing or hiding media controls, a DID_SHOW_MEDIA_CONTROLS or DID_HIDE_MEDIA_CONTROLS SDK event will be emitted with event properties containing the current animation style, timeout value, and resource list. To determine programmatically if the Brighcove media controls are being displayed, the isShowing() method can be used. To completely replace the default Brightcove show or hide media controls implementations, an application can implement the show() and hide() methods independently. This can be done directly via implementing the ShowHideController interface, or indirectly by extending the DefaultMediaController class.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ANIMATION_STYLE_FADE
      Use a fading animation style whereby ...
      static java.lang.String ANIMATION_STYLE_SLIDE
      Use a sliding animation style whereby ...
      static java.lang.String DID_HIDE_MEDIA_CONTROLS
      Standard event type used to notify an app that media controls are hidden.
      static java.lang.String DID_SHOW_MEDIA_CONTROLS
      Standard event type used to notify an app that media controls are showing.
      static java.lang.String HIDE_MEDIA_CONTROLS
      Standard event type used to emit and listen for hiding media controls.
      static java.lang.String SHOW_HIDE_ANIMATION_STYLE
      Event property key selecting an animation style, an int constant.
      static java.lang.String SHOW_HIDE_RESOURCES
      Event property key specifying the Android resource identifiers to either show or hide.
      static java.lang.String SHOW_HIDE_TIMEOUT
      Event property key specifying delay (in seconds, default is three) from showing to hiding the media controls.
      static java.lang.String SHOW_MEDIA_CONTROLS
      Standard event type used to emit and listen for showing media controls.

      void hide()

      boolean isShowing()

      void show()
      Shows the media controls.
